intro: Chorizanthe macraei, commonly known as the tall choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, dry fruits that contain one or two seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Chorizanthe macraei is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
